basic_info.name: Jason Salzetti - Chair and CEO, Deloitte Consulting LLP
basic_info.search_snippet: Jason Salzetti serves as Chair and Chief Executive Officer of Deloitte Consulting LLP, where he leads a talented team of professionals.

detailed_profile.name: Jason Salzetti
detailed_profile.position: Chair and CEO, Deloitte Consulting LLP
detailed_profile.about: Jason Salzetti serves as Chair and Chief Executive Officer of Deloitte Consulting LLP, where he leads a talented team of professionals who are dedicated to solving complex client challenges and delivering lasting value to the organizations they serve. With a Deloitte tenure of nearly 30 years, Jason has a breadth of cross-functional and cross-industry client service leadership experience as a hands-on technology partner—including most recently leading the US Government and Public Services (GPS) Industry. As a tech enthusiast, he excels at distilling complex technology challenges into actionable insights for business leaders, enabling strategic outcomes. Jason’s leadership philosophy is anchored in trust, transparency, and collaboration. He strongly believes in developing and empowering the people around him to better realize the collective potential of the team. The concept of servant leadership is central to how Jason leads, and he always keeps our clients and the market at the center of everything he does. He holds a bachelor’s degree in mathematics/applied science (finance) with a specialization in computing from UCLA.

basic_info.search_snippet: Principal, Deloitte Consulting LLP · Strategy Principal and leader of International Affairs for Deloitte's Government and Public Sector (GPS) practice.

detailed_profile.name: Tom Hodson
detailed_profile.city: Olde West Chester, Ohio, United States
detailed_profile.position: Principal, Deloitte Consulting LLP
detailed_profile.about: Strategy Principal and leader of International Affairs for Deloitte’s Government and Public Sector (GPS) practice. A SAMPLE OF PAID WORK I HAVE DONE: delivered newspapers, shoveled snow, cut grass, hung drywall, tarred a roof, served as a dormitory resident assistant, stacked library books, programmed in FORTRAN, tested the M-1 tank simulator, ran credit checks, documented the manufacturing process for a jet engine part; answered mail for a Congressman, analyzed the federal budget and Clinton health care proposal, wrote speeches for a Senator, redesigned a company chart of accounts, developed emerging market growth strategies, developed a supply chain strategy, created leadership alignment forums, evaluated hospital purchasing processes, integrated two companies, evaluated acquisition targets, helped a company cope with email overload, conducted strategic scenario planning and sold lemonade. I BELIEVE: in the Holy Trinity ... that relationships are forged and strengthened in the moments that matter, and what you choose to do in those moments can make all the difference ... that the most important question in consulting is "What problem are you trying to solve?" ... it's okay to schedule naps ... the theory of constraints .. that watching the sun rise and set is a good for the soul ... and that life is too short to drink bad coffee. CONTACT ME WHEN YOU... need help framing a problem or talking through an issue ... are interested in discussing the moments that matter in life ... or just feel in your gut that it might make sense.

publications.title: How AI Is Transforming Health and Amplifying Impact
publications.subtitle: Wall Street Journal
publications.description: It's a truly exciting time to be working at the intersection of health care and artificial intelligence, and this conversation captured in the article really underscores that. My colleagues Neal Batra, Mike McCallen, and I had the distinct opportunity to sit down with Dr. Karen DeSalvo and Amy McDonough from Google – two leaders who are right at the forefront of applying cutting-edge technology to some of health care's most pressing challenges.From my vantage point as a Deloitte Health Care Applied AI leaders, the insights shared were particularly resonant. We delved into how technologies like generative AI, and increasingly agentic AI, are moving beyond hype and demonstrating tangible potential. Dr. DeSalvo painted a compelling picture of how AI can alleviate clinician burnout by tackling administrative burdens, accelerate crucial research like drug discovery through tools like AlphaFold, and democratize access to reliable health information for people everywhere. Amy McDonough provided a fascinating perspective on consumer empowerment. Her points about leveraging generative AI to help individuals navigate their complex health data – bridging the gap between clinical records and everyday wellness metrics captured by wearables – align closely with the shift we're seeing towards more personalized and proactive health management. Ultimately, this dialogue highlighted the immense possibilities when technological innovation meets deep health care expertise. It's about augmenting human capability, improving efficiency, personalizing experiences, and fostering a more integrated, continuous approach to health. The journey requires collaboration, a focus on responsible deployment, and a commitment to demonstrating real value, but the potential to transform health for both individuals and the system at large is clearer than ever. This piece effectively captures the essence of that transformative potential.

publications.title: A new approach to managed services with data and AI
publications.subtitle: Deloitte
publications.description: Too often, many organizations fail to harvest measurable business value due to legacy ways of working and measuring progress, siloed technologies and teams, a stagnant ecosystem of partnerships or other issues. An organization's ability to generate sustainable growth depends on mastering the interplay between people, data, automation and AI.In an evergreen enterprise, all of this happens naturally, organically, automatically. It does so because the business and its ecosystem are fed by a liquid asset that flows everywhere and energizes everything: data. The DNA of these companies intertwines the best of people working with machines to make smarter, faster decisions based on human knowledge with artificial intelligence, machine learning with creative inspiration, automation with intuition - all enabled through an effective AI & Data Operations capability. In this report, we discuss what are the underpinnings of a new approach to managed services for AI and Data Operations that can help organizations deliver evergreen insights.

publications.subtitle: Deloitte
publications.description: To reap the full benefits of new artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies, banks must move beyond the hype and consider the practical applications of AI. Discover use cases for mainstream deployment of AI in banking and how to enable successful implementation.

publications.title: Google: The World`s First Information Utility?
publications.subtitle: Business and Information System Engineering
publications.description: The idea of information utilities came to naught in the 70s and 80s, but the world wide web, the Internet, mobile access, and a plethora of access devices have now made information utilities within reach. Google’s business model, IT infrastructure, and innovation strategies have created the capabilities needed for Google to become the world’s first global information utility. But, the difficulty of monetizing utility services and concerns about privacy, which could bring government regulation, might stymie Google’s growth plans.

recommendations: Michelle Gossett “Scott is everything you want in a co-worker/intern and more. From the day he stepped foot into the Marketing department at MarkLogic, Scott hit the ground running. No matter what we threw at him, Scott made sure to get it done. He asked questions when he needed to, met deadlines & communicated progress to team members. As his manager, I was most impressed by his ability to think critically and creatively – and he wasn’t afraid to question things. Scott knows that his voice and opinions add value and he’s not wrong. I am confident that Scott’s drive, knowledge and his willingness to take on any challenge will take him very far in life and recommend him with no hesitation. He would be a wonderful addition to any organization. ”

Miguel Rodriguez “It was a pleasure to work with Scott, and we were lucky to have him as a Marketing intern. In his short time at MarkLogic, he made a definite impact on our Social Media program. He was the perfect mind for our Competitor Analysis Report - not only helping us to understand what our competition is doing, but also giving recommendation on how to get more social media engagement based on his findings. He also handled ad hoc requests, like video creation/editing for YouTube promos. Scott has an amazing personality, and co-workers become "Scott fans" very quickly. Fun to work with, down to earth, and eager to help - we'll miss Scott and his contributions to our team!”

detailed_profile.name: Erin O'Rourke
detailed_profile.position: Growth Strategist @ Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: I am an energetic intrepreneur that welcomes any challenge and ambiguity with innovation and creativity. I am currently a Strategy & Change Senior Consultant focused on commercial modernization and go-to-market transformation at Deloitte. I am a hungry learner, currently focused on ecosystem approaches to better business, demand generation and lead nurturing, and innovative marketing trends. I thrive in complexity and ambiguity, hosting a track record of cross-functional experiences with a versatile skill set. Prior to Deloitte, I graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill with degrees in Political Science and Media & Journalism with a specialization in Advertising, and a minor in Media & Technology Entrepreneurship. I value teamwork and am passionate about solving problems through strategic thinking and data-driven insights, always striving to bring fresh perspectives to the table. In additional to my professional work, I am devoted to engagement initiatives including leadership roles on the Greater Washington Area Women’s Leadership Initiative, Commercial Volunteer Council, and volunteer activities outside Deloitte through my residential neighborhood (Logan Circle, DC!) and United Way. On the personal front, I am an enthusiastic traveler, Spotify-obsessed, and just beginning to explore the world of film photography.

detailed_profile.name: Ayo Odusote
detailed_profile.city: New York, New York, United States
detailed_profile.position: Principal Deloitte Consulting | Software and Platforms Subsector Leader | Business Transformation Executive Advisor | Inclusion Champion
detailed_profile.about: Ayo is a Principal in Deloitte Consulting LLP’s strategy practice with over 20 years of consulting experience, serving clients in the Technology and Telecom sectors. He advises business leaders on business transformation, with specific expertise in transforming Sales, Channel and Customer operations. Recently, his focus has been on helping his Tech sector clients transition their products and services to the Cloud and other new as-a-service business models. Ayo has a successful track record of helping clients implement new transformational capabilities - his technology background and business experience enables him to effectively play a critical leadership and mediation role, from concept through realization. Ayo also currently serves as the Diversity, Equity and Inclusion lead for Deloitte Consulting, where he focuses on creating a meaningful and consistent experience for all employees to ensure they are comfortable being their authentic selves. He is also a strong advocate for more diversity in the Creative space, driving change through groundbreaking partnerships with organizations alike BECA and Creative Ladder. Ayo joined Deloitte in 2005 after earning his MBA from the Robert H. Smith School of Business at the University of Maryland. Ayo graduated from the University of Ife, with a Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering.

publications.title: Elevate the Human Experience for Partners
publications.subtitle: WSJ
publications.description: With the increased focus on customer and employee experience, it’s easy for organizations to forget about their many partners. However, regardless what form a partnership takes—public-private contract, joint venture, or vendor-supplier agreement—it’s not simply a relationship between companies but a relationship between humans. And just as with employees and customers, meaningful and personal connections make partner relationships strong.

publications.title: Moving to a Flexible Consumption Business Model? Four Questions to Ask First
publications.subtitle: Wall Street Journal
publications.description: “You get what you pay for” may have negative connotations historically, but many of today’s technology, media, and telecommunications (TMT) companies have flipped that adage around, creating highly competitive product and service offerings. “You pay for what you get” is the bedrock of flexible consumption.To create value for their customers, many TMT companies are choosing to go with a flexible consumption business model, or a pay-per-use model. Before going down this path, companies must understand their current business model from every angle. Take a moment to answer the following four questions and see how you measure up. Solving this puzzle will help determine how future consumption-based business models will address customer requirements and market shifts.

publications.title: Turning value into revenue: What IoT players can learn from software monetization
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: Customers want connected technology, but can companies make any money from the Internet of Things? The answer is yes—and the software industry offers a possible model for finding revenue in IoT-based products and services

publications.title: Flexible consumption business models
publications.subtitle: Deloitte
publications.description: Driving growth through the right pay-per-use business models​Flexible consumption calls for an entirely new business model that changes how products and services are sold and to whom. But before companies can transition to a pay-per-use model, they must understand their current business model from every angle–from their product portfolio to how they realize revenue. Companies need detailed answers to four important questions to determine how their future consumption-based business model will address customer requirements and market shifts.

publications.title: Flexible consumption transition strategies for business
publications.subtitle: Deloitte
publications.description: What strategy will get you where you need to be?In an era of business model disruption, perhaps one of the most profound developments in the technology, media, and telecommunications world is the shift away from a model based on outright purchase or licensing to one based on consumption. But moving to a flexible consumption model is not for the faint of heart. It calls for sound strategy and a fundamentally different way of doing business. Explore the four paths that companies have typically taken to transition or expand to consumption-based models.

detailed_profile.name: Gina Schaefer
detailed_profile.position: Intelligent Automation Offering Lead at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: A leader in Intelligent Automation and Generative AI in Deloitte's AI & Data team, with over 25 years’ experience helping drive innovative solutions, at scale, to real-world business issues leveraging AI enabled automation alongside process and org transformation. I specialize in helping large enterprises take a strategic, ROI-focused approach to applying automation technologies defining scalable programs and architectures. I apply experience gained in the first 20 years of my career focused on full-cycle shared services / Global Business Services engagements to re-imagine end-to-end business in light of the capabilities enabled by ML, NLP/NLG, Generative AI, iOCR and RPA. While not immersed in the world of intelligent automation, I enjoy hiking, cycling, making furniture, and and gardening.

publications.description: The paper provides a practical point of view on how to effectively leverage the growing trends of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) and R&CA by answering questions like: • What is Robotic & Cognitive Automation?• Why should enterprises embrace R&CA and what value will be gained by embracing R&CA?• How will R&CA influence the enterprise?• How do enterprises work with R&CA and what are the next steps?

publications.title: The value of robotic process automation in shared services
publications.description: Repetitive, manual tasks are monotonous for humans and cumbersome for businesses. Robotic process automation (RPA) helps automate processes, allowing early adopters in service delivery and global business services (GBS) to achieve cost efficiencies and create more nimble and competitive businesses. At the same time, quality increases while workers free up to perform higher-level tasks and analysis.

basic_info.name: Scott Mager - US Chief Marketing Officer at Deloitte
basic_info.search_snippet: I am a principal at in Deloitte Consulting LLP and have served as a US Chief Marketing Officer, Global Ecosystems & Alliances Chief Marketing Officer.

detailed_profile.name: Scott Mager
detailed_profile.position: US Chief Marketing Officer at Deloitte
detailed_profile.about: For over three decades, I've been at the forefront of digital and marketing evolution, navigating the dynamic landscape of Advertising, Digital, PR, and Communications, culminating in my role as US Chief Marketing Officer at Deloitte. Here, I don’t just lead; I orchestrate a powerhouse of visionary marketers, designers, storytellers, and communicators, all focused on propelling our business forward and crafting narratives that resonate with our people, clients and society. I am a principal at in Deloitte Consulting LLP and have served as a US Chief Marketing Officer, Global Ecosystems & Alliances Chief Marketing Officer, and previously as National Practice Leader for Deloitte Digital’s US Advertising, Marketing & Commerce offering. My mission transcends conventional marketing. I harness the power of creativity, data analytics, AI, and transformative technology to redefine the very essence of brand engagement. We're not just telling stories; we're creating immersive experiences that forge deep connections between Deloitte, our professionals, and our clients. My passion lies in illuminating the full spectrum of Deloitte's capabilities and amplifying the profound, positive impact we deliver to our clients and the communities we serve. I'm driven by a singular goal: to empower our current and future clients, and our extraordinary professionals, with a deeper understanding of our unwavering commitment to excellence and societal advancement. When I’m not working with our incredible Deloitte Marketing team consisting of strategic marketers, designers, creatives, storytellers, architects, technologists, and communicators, you can find me supporting Daniel’s Music Foundation, cheering on my alma mater - Syracuse University, preparing for my next half or full marathon, cycling, and being with my family in New Jersey.

basic_info.search_snippet: Principal at Deloitte Consulting · As a Principal/Partner at Deloitte, I specialize in large-scale, technology-driven transformations, harnessing the power ...

detailed_profile.name: Siddharth Karia
detailed_profile.position: Principal at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: As a Principal/Partner at Deloitte, I specialize in large-scale, technology-driven transformations, harnessing the power of Generative AI and Agentic AI to drive innovation and operational excellence. My expertise in Agentic AI includes designing and deploying autonomous systems that can reason, learn, and act independently to optimize complex business processes—enabling clients to unlock new efficiencies and insights across their organizations. I am TOGAF 9 certified and bring deep domain expertise in the life sciences sector, with a particular focus on pharmaceutical R&D. My experience spans the full spectrum of R&D process areas, including clinical trial design and execution, regulatory submissions, pharmacovigilance, data management, and translational research. I work closely with clients to reimagine these processes, integrating advanced AI solutions to accelerate drug discovery, improve trial outcomes, and enhance compliance. By combining a strategic vision with hands-on technical leadership, I help life sciences organizations navigate digital disruption and achieve sustainable growth in an increasingly complex landscape.

recommendations: Dale B. “Scott was our CTO initially at World Avenue and later at Selling Source. During his time at World Avenue he did an excellent job of managing a staff of over 100 architects, developers, program managers an IT staff while maintaining several major off-site data centers. When Scott joined World Avenue he faced a project backlog of hundreds with a completion track record of only 10 to 20 per year. Scott put in a system of prioritization and resource allocation that allowed critical projects and program to move forward on a very timely basis. While at Selling Source, Scott identified internally developed "competing" efforts that had spent several million dollars without producing a result and was able to consolidate those efforts onto a single platform resulting in efforts for all future projects to be addressed and developed in a consistent manner. He instilled a professional process for evaluating and prioritizing requests and ensuring that those requests were consistent with senior management's direction. Overall, an outstanding job!”

Tom Yankowski “Scott is a stand-up individual, and always stats ahead of the technology curve. Coming into the position at DukeSolutions, Scott quickly picked up the industry and immediately applied this knowledge to providing impeccable solutions for the company. A top-notch person and dedicated employee.”

When not gaining experience at work, I am learning about tools like PyTorch and TensorFlow to learn how AI and machine learning work on the coding level. I am very interested in the crossroads of these new technologies and their implications for society, and I offer a unique perspective from my philosophy undergraduate degree about these issues.

detailed_profile.name: Julia Somers
detailed_profile.city: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
detailed_profile.position: Senior Manager at Deloitte
detailed_profile.about: Determination, laser focus, empathy, and grit are my strengths. I take pride in all stages of my professional life - from teaching, to graduate school, to my career at Deloitte. I don't believe in taking shortcuts and find that even the simplest tasks are powerful when done well. I enjoy building relationships with others while working through challenging situations that require adaptability and critical, deep thinking. I lead by example, build teams around individual strengths, and hold myself accountable while always assuming the best intent from others. I specialize in application modernization, helping clients realize their IT and business goals through technical solutions. My specialties are: o Rule Mining, including using automated software and techniques to extract business and technical rules from aging systems with limited documentation and diminishing workforce o Legacy System Operations, especially complex systems with opportunity to incrementally modernize or improve the posture of the application o Modernization Roadmaps, including legacy system analysis, modernization approach assessment, defining target state architectural visions, and defining incremental steps towards modernization

basic_info.name: Elizabeth Reid Hoffman
basic_info.search_snippet: Senior Manager at Deloitte Consulting · Whether it is a murder mystery or a business case on whether or not to implement a new operating model, ...

detailed_profile.name: Elizabeth Reid Hoffman
detailed_profile.position: Senior Manager at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Whether it is a murder mystery or a business case on whether or not to implement a new operating model, I want to solve it. With a passion for answering tough questions and figuring out the most realistic yet pioneering solutions, I pride myself on solving complex cases. As a Senior Manager with Deloitte Consulting, I bring this passion to our clients and to our business. For the past 10 years, I have worked with clients spanning the federal and state public sphere in addition to our internal leadership on how to best frame our Global Business to launch ourselves into the future of professional services. Examples of work include: - Leading efforts to transform our Global Consulting Business, working on internal global strategy, change management, stakeholder engagement, and operating model design - Leading the development of business cases and financial models for quasi-governmental and international organizations - Creating strategies around performance management and metrics - Evaluating and implementing various operating models, specifically regarding shared services organizations and centers of excellence - Helping to establish new governmental organizations stemming directly from legislation I am a driven, blunt, detailed-oriented, and loyal worker. Efficiency and the happiness of my clients, leadership, and colleagues let me know that I did my job successfully. Cliff hangers are not acceptable in my book; mysteries/issues are meant to be solved. Specialties: Strategic development and activation, performance management, change management, operating model/org design, business cases; shared services; technology implementations; legislative implementations Hobbies: Reading and watching mysteries and thrillers; exercising (running, cycling, lifting weights, playing volleyball, yoga, etc.); skiing; traveling; amateur oil painting

publications.title: Jointly evaluating the Federal Reserve’s forecasts of GDP growth and inflation
publications.subtitle: International Journal of Forecasting
publications.description: Abstract: In this paper we jointly evaluate the Federal Reserve staff forecasts of U.S. real output growth and the inflation rate, assuming that the forecasts are to be used as inputs for the Taylor rule. Our simple methodology generates “policy forecast errors” which have a direct interpretation for the impact of forecast errors on the target interest rate given by the Taylor rule. Without interest rate smoothing, we find that, on average, the Taylor rule target interest rate would have been approximately a full percentage point away from the intended target because of errors in forecasting output growth and inflation. Our results are robust to changes in the forecast horizon and to changes in the weights on the variables in the policy rule.

detailed_profile.name: David Rudini
detailed_profile.position: Deloitte - Lead Client Service Partner/Lead Consulting Partner - multiple clients in Retail and Consumer Products
detailed_profile.about: Bringing the power of analytics to business—with an entrepreneurial bent and the firm’s talented network. Proponent of the amazing impact coaches and teachers have on our youth. A principal at Deloitte Consulting LLP for almost two decades, what I enjoy most about my work at Deloitte is playing an active role in developing the next generation of leaders, and introducing solutions to the market that drive business outcomes. We are in the age of robotics, cognitive, big data, analytics and to be on a forefront of such a powerful market dynamic is both humbling and exciting… the ability to drive human-machine relationships is an especially exciting challenge. Born and raised in Connecticut, I attended the University of Pennsylvania, played college football, and later got my MBA at their Wharton School of Business. I continue to value the educational ecosystem I experienced and have given back by coaching now more than 30 youth sports teams over the last ten years, impacting around 300 kids and their families.

positions.subtitle: Deloitte Consulting
positions.description: As Chief Analytics Officer, I see an issue that is top of mind within global business today and aspire to help organizations drive smarter insights and accomplish stronger outcomes with analytics and cognitive technologies. By starting with the desired outcomes and incorporating scientific rigor, advanced digital platforms and deep sector experience to further the effort, our teams are helping companies uncover the insights that create competitive advantage. Prior to my current role, I served as the east regional leader and the US COO of Deloitte’s Human Capital practice. I also managed our global SAS alliance. To work in a firm that has such tremendous resources and market reach, but also encourages entrepreneurship, is an incredible combination.

detailed_profile.name: Heidi Marijczyn
detailed_profile.position: Crafting Careers, Fueling Teams| Recruiter, Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Short Story: My specialties include Full life-cycle talent acquisition, relationship building, candidate tracking systems, negotiation and learning & development facilitation. Long Story: If you know me, you won’t be surprised by the fact that I started talking at the 1 year mark. The gift of the gab never took a break. From joining the debate team to being the editor of my high school newspaper, my passion has always been rooted in communication and it’s still at the core of my professional career. Getting to know the people you’re working with, working for and joining on a team, to me, are essential keys to success. I also believe that your personal life and professional life work together – each fuels the other. So my journey has included moving to new cities, taking on new opportunities and immersing myself in the cultural experiences around me. Each role in my career has taught me something that I’ve built on and brought to the next. My personal and professional experiences have taught me the following about myself: • I’m an Organizing geek: files, spreadsheets, clear bins…. • Problem solving fuels me: What is the challenge? Let’s start brainstorming and get creative. • Positive acknowledgement and praise for my contributions go a long way and help me stay engaged. • Lifelong Learning is my jam (and peanut butter): learning keeps me curious, engaged and ready for the next adventure. Recruiting for Deloitte is a win-win scenario where I get to meet a variety of people daily, assist in the growth of our businesses while also contributing positively to professional journeys.

publications.title: Does scarcity make you dumb? A behavioral understanding of how scarcity diminishes our decision making and control
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: When people lack the tools and resources needed to operate effectively, they fall prey to the scarcity mind-set. If left unchecked, scarcity can have deleterious effects on performance. The good news is, leaders have an opportunity to help prevent scarcity before it happens.

publications.title: 3D opportunity and the digital thread: Additive manufacturing ties it all together
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: While additive manufacturing has become a crucial part of the design process, it has not reached critical mass at the enterprise level. The digital thread—a single, seamless strand of data that stretches from the initial design to the finished part—can help scale and enhance AM capabilities.

publications.title: Industry 4.0 and manufacturing ecosystems: Exploring the world of connected enterprises
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: The marriage of advanced manufacturing techniques with information technology, data, and analytics is driving another industrial revolution—one that invites manufacturing leaders to combine information technology and operations technology to create value in new and different ways.

publications.title: Editorial: Behavioral insights- Putting Humans in the loop: Deloitte Review Issue 18
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: As the march of “smart” technologies seemingly takes on a life of its own, it is worth remembering that advances in the behavioral sciences can better enable the human-centric design of programs, technologies, and organizations.

publications.title: 3D opportunity for end-use products: Additive manufacturing builds a better future
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: As the technology improves, product manufacturers are increasingly using additive manufacturing (AM) to enable new designs and improve product performance relative to products manufactured with conventional techniques.

publications.title: 3D opportunity in aerospace and defense: Additive manufacturing takes flight
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: The aerospace and defense industry is increasingly using additive manufacturing to reduce material costs, decrease labor content, and increase availability of parts at point of use, which may have a dramatic impact on the supply chain.

publications.title: The 3D opportunity primer: The basics of additive manufacturing
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: If the past is prologue, the role that additive manufacturing (3D printing) plays in the manufacturing value chain will likely grow in scope, scale, and complexity. This article provides an overview of additive manufacturing for those who are new to this important emerging process.

publications.title: 3D Opportunity: Additive manufacturing paths to performance, innovation, and growth
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Review/Deloitte University Press
publications.description: Additive manufacturing technology can break existing performance trade-offs by reducing the capital needed to achieve scale and scope economies. Understanding how this can be done requires a review of how scale and scope economies shape certain product manufacturing and distribution decisions.

publications.title: The answer is 9,142: Understanding the influence of disruption risk on inventory decision making
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Review/Deloitte University Press
publications.description: The question was how many units of inventory a manager should order when faced with a possible disruption in supply. The correct answer is not guesswork, but based on 150 years of theory and practice. We examine individual choices made in this critical situation—and the results are not encouraging.

publications.title: Location, learning, and logistics: A framework for managing trade-offs in capacity location decisions
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Review/Deloitte University Press
publications.description: Business leaders who misjudge the location of production relative to the location of product and process development resources may adversely impact the company’s long-term competitive position. We explore the link between production location decisions, the nature of the capabilities required to create a product, and the ability of a company to develop the next-generation technologies it may seek.

projects.title: 3D opportunity: The course on additive manufacturing for business leaders: Massive Open Online Course
projects.description: Our online course is designed to help expand your knowledge of the business implications of additive manufacturing and inform your choices about how and where to invest in these technologies.

activity.title: Really proud of my firm, putting its money where its mouth is to develop capabilities in space!

basic_info.name: Mike Brinker - Principal at Deloitte Consulting
basic_info.search_snippet: Mike is a Principal with Deloitte Consulting and a digital pioneer. His deep insights and strategies across industry, technology, and creative marketing

detailed_profile.name: Mike Brinker
detailed_profile.position: Principal at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Mike is a Principal with Deloitte Consulting and a digital pioneer. His deep insights and strategies across industry, technology, and creative marketing help organizations reimagine their business and disrupt their competitors. In his 29 years at Deloitte, Mike has incubated numerous technology practices, led major acquisitions, joint ventures, alliances, built Deloitte’s India technology practice, and was instrumental at launching and leading Deloitte Digital to a multi-billion dollar business. Mike has been on the forefront of digital transformation and digital marketing, driving change with organizations and industries to redefine how they engage with customers, employees, and partners, creating more connected, data driven, human experiences, using solutions based on eCommerce, CRM, mobile platforms, spatial computing,, GenAI, intelligent marketing, creative campaigns, branding, social media, analytics, and content. Based in California, Mike is also the global relationship leader for Deloitte’s partnership with Apple and he has served dozens of clients in the retail, hospitality, telecommunications, technology and media sectors.

basic_info.search_snippet: Managing Director | AI, Data, & Design | Deloitte Consulting · Dr. Scott Pobiner is an idea incubator who integrates his career arc across design, ...

detailed_profile.name: Dr. Scott Pobiner
detailed_profile.position: Managing Director | AI, Data, & Design | Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Dr. Scott Pobiner is an idea incubator who integrates his career arc across design, technology, and strategy to create exciting and practical applications for new technologies in the Technology, Media, and Entertainment fields. Throughout my career I have held leading roles designing and building systems to support users throughout the data, analytics, and AI ecosystem, often working with clients and teams from conceptualization through execution. I engage deeply in computer-human interaction, interactive technologies, and innovation in design. My unique perspective on ‘interface’ bridges intellectual and practical realms, shaping my leadership at Deloitte in areas where AI, machine learning, and human experience converge in technology and media sectors.

positions.subtitle: Parsons The New School for Design
positions.description: The Design and Management Program is an accredited 4-year Bachelor of Business Administration program in Design and Management. As Director my responsibilities ranged very widely from basic administrative oversight to strategic planning and implementation. During my directorship the student population grew from 475 to approximately 575. Partnerships with companies such as Kiehl's and JP Morgan Bank were established, and the program was integrated into the newly formed School of Design Strategies.As Director I oversaw 12 full-time faculty, approximately 100 part-time faculty, and an administrative core of advisors and administrators. The program's academic offerings encapsulate a wide variety of areas including basic business management, financial planning, design research methods, innovation, and core design studios. I oversaw the development of the program's first online courses as well as the planning of our traditional annual curriculum. In addition I was responsible for working with faculty to plan and execute short and long term strategic goals for the program, managing its daily operations, helping to develop special initiatives such as lecture series', external partnership development, and a new administrative structure for the newly established School of Design Strategies.

recommendations: Osama Qazi “Scott is a leader at a partner organization of ours. I have had many interactions with him to discuss on going projects and technology. Scott is an excellent communicator and a great listener. I am impressed with his ability to connect with his audience and deliver value that is not only on point but also incredibly effective. I have found him to be very respectful and very thoughtful. He is greatly valued member of our extended teams and I look to him to be the thought leader that he is.”

Liz (Eddy) Scully “I was lucky enough to have Scott as a professor at Parsons the New School for Design. As a student, I sometimes felt like professors went too easy on us, making it easy to cut corners. Scott was the first professor that really pushed me. I had absolutely no clue what design thinking really meant when I began his course. By the end, it was a part of my every day... and later, a big part of every job I've had. Now, I run my own company and continue to draw from his teachings and advice. I still refer to him as one of my most inspiring teachers. P.s. Scott was MY professor. LinkedIn didn't offer that as an option for some reason. ”

publications.title: Commercial spend in the consumer products industry: Ready for zero-based budgeting?
publications.subtitle: Monitor Deloitte
publications.description: In the consumer products industry, commercial spend has historically been "safe" from corporate budget turmoil, but profitability pressures and data analytics are making it an increasingly acceptable lever for cost management and margin improvement. Big data and analytics are enabling consumer product companies to make informed, confident decisions about commercial spend based on specific campaign performance—and opening the door for zero-based budgeting (ZBB).

publications.title: Brazil's Elevated Interest Rates: A Case of Irrational Pessimism or Gaurded Optimism?
publications.subtitle: University of Florida
publications.description: A review of monetary policy and the macroeconomic environment in Brazil from 2003 - 2006. The author makes the argument that though the country's macroeconomic situation stabilized with the Real Plan in 1994, twelve years later global financial markets had not recognized this stability and that Brazil's country risk premium remained irrationally elevated, representing an opportunity for investment.

recommendations: Byron Sanders “In the 3 years working with Jason Williamson, a lot sticks out in my mind of this man. Most of all the willingness to go the extra step to make sure that those he was supervising were taken care of. Not once did a request or a problem occur that Jason was not quickly able to handle in a professional and kind manner. Beyond his superior abilities as a supervisor Jason has more experience and solid knowledge than many those of in his field. His intelligence and expertise have prevented future problems from occurring and quickly solving those that did occur. I would recommend Jason Williamson for any position that he felt he was able to accomplish, because if Jason thinks he can do it, then he can do it and make it look easy.”

LinkedIn User “I employed Jason Williamson during a critical phase of our company's growth. We found that our business was relying more heavily on the IT aspect of operation, but we were not staffed to make the leap, nor were we resourced to hire the necessary staff full time. Mr. Williamson began with a thorough assessment of our existing operation, strategic goals, budget, IT-specific needs. He then worked with us over the next two weeks to formulate a comprehensive IT plan, spent time with our in-house IT staff to initiate the project, develop policies and procedures, develop and implement a security plan, and put us in contact with people and companies to help make it a reality. Additionally, he took the time to follow up and make sure that the project continued to completion, offering help when necessary. Overall, his help allowed our company to formalize and strengthen our IT operation, and placed the business in a better position to move forward without the liability of a weak IT operation. Highly recommended.”

publications.title: The Future Vision of Content Personalization through Trusted Curation
publications.subtitle: Motion Image Journal, Volume 133, No. 1 (Jan/Feb)
publications.description: Future Content Personalization techniques are likely to flip the power dynamic between centralized content producers/distributors and networked media consumers. Critical to this power shift will be personalized control of all consumer data and subsequent viewer preference matching that will impact how content is produced, how data is managed, and how advertising is delivered.This paper envisions a new conceptual and viewing-context aware AI-enabled entity in the media ecosystem - the “Curator Agent.” We explore the required innovations for this future, fully trusted technology to enable hyper-personalized and context-aware content to become a reality.Keywords. Audience segmentation, trust, future, cloud, content provider agents, computing, relevant advertising, personal profile, Curator Agent, viewer control, content curator, artificial intelligence, generative AI

publications.title: Content Personalization; a Future Vision
publications.subtitle: Society of Motion Pictures and Television Engineers (SMPTE)
publications.description: Content personalization has the potential to generate compelling versions of documentaries, dramas, sports recaps, news summaries, movies, and advertisements that dynamically match each viewer’s interests – the extreme relevance increasing audience engagement. Additionally, rich viewer-controlled personal preference data in turn increases the value of subscription and advertising revenue streams. However, there is a growing and competing tension between content distributors’ desire to serve precise and meaningful recommendations for viewers and viewers’ willingness to allow access to their personal data, especially to unknown or untrusted organizations. The emerging need for content providers is to have a more comprehensive understanding of audience preferences and for viewers the ability to carry their preferences across all content providers. To address these needs, a secure privacy-assured mechanism to support rapid transparent use of data would address these competing tensions. Today, neither a technical solution nor protocol standard exist to support this vision. The purpose of this paper is to explore the potential of a data rich, viewer controlled content personalization ecosystem.Keywords. audience segmentation, cloud, content stitching, content provider agents, content recommendation, content relevance, content staging, content targeting, compelling content, data ownership, edge services, relevant advertising, personal profile, personalized production, personalized programming, viewer agents, viewer control, viewer preference identification

detailed_profile.name: Jim Rowan
detailed_profile.position: US Head of AI at Deloitte
detailed_profile.about: As the US Head of AI at Deloitte, I collaborate with external technology organizations, clients, and Deloitte’s business leaders to help our clients achieve their AI ambitions. The rapid advancement of AI deeply fascinates me—it's transforming how we work and interact. My goal is to explore and connect on how we can harness the transformative power of AI to reshape the future for our clients, driven by a shared curiosity and a passion for innovation. Beyond my client work, I’ve held several leadership roles at Deloitte, including my current role as a principal in Deloitte Consulting LLP. I’ve also served as the National Managing Partner for our US Strategy & Analytics practice, US AI & Data Operations Offering Leader, and US Talent Leader for AI & Data. My experience spans the life sciences, health care, and telecommunications industries, with a strong focus on applying analytics, planning, forecasting, and digital transformation to enhance finance functions. I am a proud Boston College Carroll School of Management alum, currently living outside Boston with my wife and four amazing kids

positions.title: Principal (Equity Partner)
positions.description_html:
History of Firm and Leadership Responsibilities as Principal:
Head of AI - US Firm ( Current):
- Lead AI and Generative AI initiatives across our US Firm
- Establish campaigns, investment processes, external marketing presence and eminence to help amplify Deloitte’s positioning
- Presented at multiple internal and external forums to advocate for the use of AI to drive value for our clients to support our internal adoption of AI solutions
- Lead Deloitte’s Enabling Areas AI transformation

National Offering Portfolio Leader, Strategy and Analytics: (June 2023 – July 2024)
- Manage the P&L for a $2B+ business comprised of services and asset-based solutions across our strategy capabilities (business, tech, AI & data) as well as our AI & Data capabilities
- Led efforts to simplify internal operations and integrate services across our matrix organization
- Supported large deal constructs and sales efforts

AI & Data Operations Offering Leader (June 2021- May 2023):
- Launched a managed services offering for our AI & Data business and grew it rapidly over the course of two years from $80M to $300M
- Recruited multiple external leaders and assembled a new go-to-market team
- Created a marketing, branding and eminence campaign to change the definition of our managed services organization

High-level Client Service Activities (2015 - Current)
- Delivered large scale finance transformation programs at a number of pharmaceutical and med tech clients
- Delivered enterprise reporting and analytics solutions to support better decision making and insights
- Establish AI and automation COEs to enable back office efficiencies
- Delivered master data management and data cataloging projects to support foundational data capabilities
- Leveraged solutions across a number of technology platforms including ERPs from SAP and Oracle as well as core MDM and data capabilities from Informatica
- Delivered multiple client labs for the CFO and direct reports

publications.description: Traditionally, C-suite executives have viewed core operations through the lens of cost. A singular focus on cost reduction, however, results in other, more significant costs that can drag down your business in four ways: stagnant innovation, ever-growing complexity, poor agility, and missed potential for transformation.

publications.title: Experiential Learning in a Management Information Systems Course: Simulating IT Consulting and CRM System Procurement
publications.subtitle: Communications of the Association for Information Systems
publications.description: Educating management students in technology-based disciplines can be enhanced through experiential team projects simulating the activities employees perform in actual technology jobs. This paper describes an experiential team project the authors use in the Management Information Systems course at Boston College. The project was developed jointly by Boston College faculty and consultants from the Boston office of a major consulting firm. The project involves student teams playing the roles of IT consultants who must compete against one another to win a consulting engagement at an imaginary company.

detailed_profile.name: Siva Kantamneni
detailed_profile.position: Principal / Partner at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: A result-oriented technology executive with 25+ years of professional experience in designing large scale enterprise solutions, account management, sales and delivery in the travel, hospitality and transportation industry. Proven track record with a unique combination of sales leadership, delivery excellence, deep technical and subject matter expertise. Outstanding skills cultivating relationships with customers, colleagues, business partners and other stakeholders while generating positive results. Key highlights include: • Currently serves as the technology lead for Deloitte's Travel, Hospitality and Services sector • Responsible for developing IBM’s offerings in the hospitality and container shipping industries. • As a practice executive for Travel and Transportation Industry Solutions group, developed and implemented innovative frameworks. • Managed programs of over $ 20 Million with technical oversight, P&L and account relationship responsibilities. • Excellent commercial and business skills; believer in building strong business relationships • Strategic thinker, leadership and people management skills, excellent analytical capabilities, strong communication. • Recipient, 2002 IBM award for technical leadership excellence; 2004 IBM award for project delivery excellence; 2006, 2007, 2009 and 2012 IBM award for services excellence and 2012 IBM award for sales eminence. • Served as the Chief Technology Officer for two Silicon Valley-based companies namely Vectiv Corporation and OnVantage Inc. • Managed Product Architecture for Airline Solutions Group at Sabre, Inc. and American Airlines. Eminence: • Served on the Board of Advisors for San Mateo, CA based Privacy Right, Inc. • Speaker at HiTec, Oracle Industry Connect, TRAVDEX, Open Travel Alliance (OTA) and Harvard Business School. • Recipient, OTA's "Setting the Standard" award. • Frequent author with articles published in Hospitality Upgrade Magazine and Wall Street Journal

publications.title: Services – SERVICES 2018
publications.subtitle: Springer
publications.description: This book constitutes the refereed proceedings of the 14th World Congress on Services, SERVICES 2018, held as part of the Services Conference Federation, SCF 2018, in Seattle, USA, in June 2018.The 10 full papers and 3 short papers presented were carefully reviewed and selected from 22 submissions. The papers cover topics in the field of software foundations and applications with a focus on novel approaches for engineering requirements, design and architectures, testing, maintenance and evolution, model-driven development, software processes, metrics, quality assurance and new software economics models, search-based software engineering, benefiting day-to-day services sectors and derived through experiences, with appreciation to scale, pragmatism, transparency, compliance and/or dependability.

publications.subtitle: 2018 HITEC Bytes Special Report
publications.description: A solid events-driven architecture with context and location aware technology supported by data infrastructure creates a strong foundation to take advantage of tech innovations.

publications.title: Voice Recognition in the Hospitality Industry
publications.subtitle: Hospitality Upgrade Magazine
publications.description: In the not too distant past, the idea of talking to machines and instructing them to perform tasks would have been the stuff of science fiction, but with recent advancements in voice recognition, speech processing and allied technologies, this has become practical and possible; therefore, advancements in voice recognition are becoming part of the evolving industry landscape.Voice recognition is a technology where one speaks to a “smart” device which processes human speech, deciphers a question or command, and returns an appropriate response. This technology has been leveraged by many technology manufacturers who have equipped mobile phones with assistants in addition to building products for the home. The ability to tie in to other technologies, thereby allowing voice-driven automation, has captured consumer mind space and share of wallet.In a technology space that is becoming rapidly crowded, different industry players are forming alliances with the objective of staving off competition. It is no surprise that major hospitality industry players have been exploring opportunities to leverage voice recognition technology as well.

publications.title: The Potential for RPA & Blockchain to Transform Hospitality
publications.subtitle: Hospitality Upgrade Magazine
publications.description: RPA and blockchain technology have already found some traction within the travel and hospitality landscape. A couple of airlines are already exploring these technologies and their applicability to baggage, retail, distribution and loyalty2. Some potential and existing applications of RPA and blockchain working together in the travel industry.

publications.title: Smart Travel Assistant Powered by AI
publications.subtitle: Hospitality Upgrade Magazine
publications.description: The modern world we live in is constantly evolving. One great example is recent advances in artificial intelligence (AI), a branch of computer science that deals with simulated intelligent behavior in computers. Does this futuristic-sounding technology have a place in the hospitality industry? Yes. Its self-learning capabilities allow our systems to better sense what patrons want to do, comprehend what they are doing and act on that information. This drives innovative opportunities like creating proactive solution offerings by sensing customer needs, driving efficiency and optimization across the value chain, offering personalized expert level advice and suggestions.

publications.title: Leveraging Blockchain for Loyalty
publications.subtitle: Hospitality Upgrade Magazine
publications.description: Loyalty management is a key aspect of any business striving to achieve and maintain a strong relationship with its customers. This practice not only recognizes loyal and frequent customers, but also serves as a marketing tool to entice new customers with attractive rewards. However, existing loyalty management systems haven’t been able to aid the aggressive market growth owing to inherent issues like disparate data sources, inefficient systems, unattractive reward points, delayed redemptions, security threats and overdrawn settlement processes. Loyalty management systems can greatly benefit from a unified platform that provides a 360-degree view to the customers at near real-time speed.

publications.title: Internet of Things in Hospitality
publications.subtitle: Hospitality Upgrade Magazine, Spring 2016
publications.description: The IoT and what it entails is still uncertain and can be unsettling for hospitality technologyprofessionals tasked with building and maintaining technology infrastructures, and for the hoteliersthat rely on them to provide more services and capabilities for their organizations. Hospitality organizations that can build services and capabilities by leveraging IoT may become disrupters in their industry and potentially gain a competitive edge over others.

publications.title: The Connected Hotel – What’s Next? Get in the Game
publications.subtitle: Hospitality Upgrade Magazine
publications.description: Technology is everywhere. We go to sleep with it, soothed by the sounds of waves crashing onto a rocky shoreline. Our smartphones monitor our sleep patterns and gently wake us at the optimal moment. And whether it’s to kill the alarm or check messages, we reach for that phone first thing once we’re awake.

publications.title: BEACONS - A Ray of Hope?
publications.subtitle: Hospitality Upgrade Magazine
publications.description: CREATING AN "ALWAYS AWARE” NETWORK THAT PROVIDES DETAILS WHERE GUESTS ARE SITUATED ON PROPERTY, BEACON TECHNOLOGY PROVIDES PROMOTIONAL, PERSONALIZED OFFERS OR JUST PEACE OF MIND FOR GUESTS

publications.title: Cloud Computing for T&T
publications.subtitle: IBM
publications.description: For more than three years, the travel and transportationindustry has been weathering a perfect storm. Not onlyhave they faced economic headwinds, but they have also hadto contend with a commoditized industry and a price-sensitive,brand-agnostic customer who is always hunting for thebest deal.In such turbulent environments, travel companies arelooking for ways to cut operating expenses, introducepredictability into IT costs and link operating expensesto business volumes. Cloud computing represents a keytechnology in delivering new economics, rapid deploymentof services and tight alignment with business goals. Thiswhite paper examines travel and transportation industryissues and challenges, and makes a case for more widespreadadoption of cloud-ready workloads.

patents.title: IDENTIFYING SERVICES AND ASSOCIATED CAPABILITIES IN A NETWORKED COMPUTING ENVIRONMENT
patents.description: In general, embodiments of the present invention classify cloud computing environments based on the abstraction layers that the cloud computing environments span and by combining the re-usable capabilities/logical components from these layers. In a typical embodiment, input (e.g., a set of requirements, a set of preferences, a set of costs parameters, and/or a request for feedback) pertaining to a set of services available in the networked computing environment is received from a requester via a network node. Based on the input, a set of capabilities and a corresponding set of logical components of the networked computing environment are identified. Thereafter, a set of providers capable of providing at least one of the set of services is identified and ranked. The set of logical components is then configured to provide the set of services according to the input, and made available to the requester.

patents.title: Avatar Service for Multi-Channel Systems With Full-Scale Business Context Sensitivity
patents.description: Handling changes in business context for a plurality of users in a multi-channel interactive information environment having a business context manager, an avatar service having a plurality of avatar service instances associated with the plurality of users, and a user information manager managing user preferences associated with the plurality of users.

patents.title: Software architecture that can sense and respond to contextual and state information
patents.description: A software architecture that can sense and respond to context and state information is disclosed. The software architecture includes a semantic filter to correlate individual events in an event stream to make the event stream consistent with an ontology. Events in the event stream are substituted with higher order events, resulting in an actionable event stream containing recognizable patterns. Patterns in the actionable event stream are detected and matched with event processing policies to generate an action stream indicating actions to be taken in the real world.

recommendations: Parker Lytle “I've had the privilege of working with Babette for over three years at Deloitte Consulting within the InsightStudio, Deloitte's analytics incubator and center of excellence. In that time I have come to know her incredible drive which has enabled delivery of meaningful and impactful work for our clients. She has helped to grow the team from a small group of less than 20 practitioners to what is now over 200 people strong, expanding our wide range of analytics abilities and expertise. Her efforts in the Healthcare Provider space in particular have resulted in many happy clients and a continuously growing list of projects and opportunities for the team to work on. I have also seen firsthand her deep appreciation and caring for our team within the Studio that she leads. She is not only a strong engagement leader, but also a mentor and a role model for the more junior members of the team. She provides career guidance, growth opportunities, and constructive feedback to the many practitioners that look to her as their leader. She is a significant leader on the Studio team and her impact is evident in the growth and success of this group.”

Kevin Nelson “Supporting Babette was one of the most valuable experiences in my Healthcare Consulting career. We delivered various projects spanning 2 years at Deloitte Consulting. I can first-hand endorse her ability to build a strong team culture and develop others in the midst of delivering complex and high quality projects/deliverables for our clients. Her leadership and project delivery are clear strengths, but it is her ability to think creatively and innovate that set her apart. Babette does not settle for the status quo or for a "cookie cutter" solution; rather, she always thinks and delivers at the next level. Why settle for a slightly improved process when you can develop a new and automated process? Why simply provide an assessment when you can discover and solve for the root cause? Working with an innovative leader like Babette was refreshing, changed the way I approach and solve problems, and helped shape the professional I am today. I highly recommend Babette and would welcome the opportunity to work with her in the future.”

basic_info.search_snippet: Christine is a principal at Deloitte Consulting LLP, where she leads the Application Modernization & Innovation healthcare sector practice.

detailed_profile.name: Christine Medina
detailed_profile.position: Principal at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Christine is a principal at Deloitte Consulting LLP, where she leads the Application Modernization & Innovation healthcare sector practice. In her practice leadership role, she is responsible for driving Deloitte’s go-to-market strategy in the sector, as well as helping clients realize business value through AI, modernization, and the cloud. She also works with some of the largest healthcare organizations in the country, helping them with their most strategic and complex transformations. She leads large-scale global technology programs that have resulted in first-in-industry solutions and serves as the foundation for improving the quality of care and health equity while creating efficiencies.

recommendations: Rodrigo Celis “Adarsh and I worked on a number of cross functional projects and on every occasion it was a pleasure to work with him. His technical expertise combined with his ability to understand business needs and transform that into technology are excellent. Adarsh always maintains a calmed and relaxed attitude even under the most stressful situations while supporting his teams or business partners. I would welcome the opportunity to work with him in the future and I’m sure that anywhere he goes he will make a significant and positive impact”

Brad Bennett “Adarsh and I worked while he was serving as the Technical Lead for a multi-million dollar multi-year cross organizational database driven profile application. This project was VERY complex with many deep level nuances requiring integration with and consideration of various applications and systems across the company’s product portfolio. Adarsh's professionalism, skill and expertise were exemplary. He quickly became our technology leader bring both his tremendous technical skill and his business understanding to bear on the many challenges we faced. Adarsh is tireless in his efforts and always put forth 150% effort to meet the time requirements as well as technical needs of his customers (both internal and external). Not only is Adarsh an excellent technologist he has an innate ability when interacting with customers. He communicates effectively with them as an authoritative source while also instilling confidence in his organizations ability to identify, craft and deliver solutions to meet their needs. In short it was a true pleasure and privilege to work with such a capable and knowledge expert. Any company should consider itself fortunate to have Adarsh as a member of their team.”

detailed_profile.name: Brian Augustian
detailed_profile.position: Retired Principal, Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: I am retired after 33 years at Deloitte Consulting, including 24 as a Principal. I used my training as a Fellow to the Society of Actuaries to utilize analytics to solve a wide variety of business issues for our healthcare clients. I held numerous leadership roles during my time at Deloitte, including serving as the national leader of our retirement practice, leader of our India-based Human Capital practice, led our US-based Human Capital Life Sciences and Health Care industry team and served as Lead Deloitte partner on several of our most important healthcare clients. My last few years were focused on negotiating mutually agreeable contracts with our largest and most complicated clients. In 2004, I founded a group of senior Human Resource executives from Deloitte’s healthcare clients and friends who partake in semi-annual meetings that are still going strong today.

recommendations: Sophia Nelson “I had the opportunity to work with Jenny for six months during the design phase of a Global Business Services transformation for a Fortune 500 Life Sciences / Pharma client. As my manager, Jenny demonstrated outstanding leadership abilities by communicating clearly and effectively, offering support in a number of different ways and enabling each member of the team to exceed expectations both internally and with the client. As a Senior Manager at Deloitte, Jenny had a number of competing priorities, including managing multiple projects outside of the one we were on, which meant we often worked virtually together, even so, she took several actions right away to ensure that I was set up for success. Some examples included: 1) matching me with a 'peer mentor', someone which I could ask questions or share ideas in a safe environment, 2) sharing sample deliverables to clearly demonstrate the direction or standard she expected--which is particularly helpful when working virtually 3) providing consistent and structured feedback--with each interaction she would articulate the positives of a deliverable and areas of opportunity--this continuous stream of feedback not only helped me to grow but also allowed us to find a rhythm of working together in a quick and efficient manner. While Jenny has a take-charge personality coupled with high standards, she truly cares about her teams and enables them to own and lead their workstreams.”

Keri Robertson Morelock “Jenny teaches, guides, and delivers. Whether in service to her clients or to her project teams, her approach as a consultant is focused on making those around her better. Jenny’s ability to provide mentorship is truly exceptional. She consistently takes the time to help her teams grow and push themselves. Jenny is a natural leader and teacher and it is clear that she takes these roles seriously. Jenny also casts a wide net– I have seen her provide mentorship to practitioners across our organization in both a consistent and highly effective manner. Jenny’s ability to enable others to excel extends beyond her project teams. Her approach to client service is not just to deliver an idea, but to partner with her clients and provide perspective and expertise that helps them to develop a practical and impactful solution that addresses their organization’s needs. Finally, throughout my two years of working with Jenny, I have been consistently impressed by her ability to get results – she is able to organize and understand large amounts of nuanced data to provide outstanding client service that consistently generates impactful solutions. It is truly rare to come across someone as talented as Jenny. ”

publications.title: The No-Collar Workforce in Life Sciences and Healthcare
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Tech Trends 2018
publications.description: When humans and machines team up, improvement in outcomes and job satisfaction can rise together.The nature of work across almost every industry is being disrupted by rapidly evolving digital technology—driving increased automation, affecting the proximity of where work is performed, and giving rise to new and open talent models.As emerging technologies continue to gain traction and shift the way work is performed, organizations across industries have a tremendous opportunity to reimagine worker roles to serve more strategic objectives, considering the human value-added skills necessary to support a hybrid workforce model in which technology augments human performance.The term “no-collar” workforce references a powerful collaboration of humans and technology where the unique strengths of both can be leveraged. Across health plans, health care providers, and life sciences organizations, the move to a no-collar workforce creates a compelling opportunity to improve clinical outcomes, reduce per capita costs, enhance the patient experience, and create a more fulfilling and effective workforce.

publications.title: Embracing the future of work to unlock R&D productivity: Measuring the return from pharmaceutical innovation 2018
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Center for Health Solutions
publications.description: The biopharma industry continues to face challenges this year, with projected returns on investment in R&D at the lowest levels since our analysis began in 2010. However, there are opportunities to reverse this trend, which will require new ways of working and a complete digital transformation to unlock R&D productivity and deliver the next generation of scientific breakthroughs.This ninth annual study by the Deloitte Center for Health Solutions analyzes the return on investment that 12 large cap biopharma companies expect to achieve from their late-stage pipelines, along with four smaller, more specialized companies for comparison. As well as the core analysis, the report also provides recommendations of how the future of work, who does it, and where it gets done, can help companies to unlock R&D productivity.

publications.title: Trial Master File: Getting Them Right The First Time, Every Time
publications.subtitle: In Vivo: The Business & Medicine Report
publications.description: Trial Master Files (TMF) provide evidence that life sciences organizations complied with regulations and adhered to best practices in conducting clinical trials. Pharmaceutical firms can save time and money by building a TMF process that ensures they get it right from day one. This article describes how Deloitte helped Pfizer and Roche through a TMF transformation – how to get their TMF right every time the first time, which required new process, technology, but also demanded creating sustainable changes in the organizations

recommendations: Emma Scales “Julie is one of the most talent Learning Professionals I have come across in my career. Her ability to partner with senior leaders, deliver to exacting standards, and produce curricula that resonates globally, is unparalleled. She is a passionate person, full of ideas, lateral thinking and high-standards. This combination has made her a trusted partner to leaders from all crafts and industries from countries around the world. I have watched her coach, develop and mentor strategists, facilitators, technologists, executives, and instructional designers across the world. Her focus on developing their unique capabilities and personal strengths, not gaps, has helped many people to progress significantly in their careers. Personally, I still turn to Julie for advice and inspiration. She has always been a source of honest and insightful perspective that helps focus whatever I am doing on what is critical. She is an asset to any organisation, and a true leader within the learning profession. ”

Amy Ingram “Julie is a powerhouse. While at Aquent, I worked with her in a several capacities, first as a manager--one of her customers/stakeholders. In that role, I turned to Julie to help get new hires ramped up, sought her on a consultative basis to help with performance issues and just-in-time training for my team on new processes and initiatives. Julie's expertise and guidance was always right on point and helped me get new folks ramped up seamlessly and quickly. I also worked closely with Julie as part of an internal task force launching our national referral program. Julie not only provided a well-thought out plan for getting our message to right audiences; she also delivered an amazing volume of internal training materials (job aids, interactive online training modules, live launch calls) in a very short period of time. Lastly, I worked her for an unfortunately brief period of time as a Learning Services Manager at Aquent. In that brief time, I learned an incredible amount just by following and listening in her wake. I was and am in awe at the workload Julie manages without batting an eye. She ROCKS.”

publications.title: The evolution of the cloud architect’s role
publications.subtitle: Deloitte OnCloud Podcast
publications.description: Cloud has put the systems architect at the center of successBefore cloud, system architects lived by rigid system requirements—receive them, build to spec, and move on. That was their world. However, with the ascendance of cloud, that world has changed. Architects are now expected to be just as smart and agile as the applications they build. In this episode, David Linthicum and guest, Deloitte’s Vasa Vishveshwara, discuss the ever-changing, ever-expanding role of the system architect in the world built by cloud. According to Vasa, architects have to be just as well-versed in the business as they are in cloud technology. And, to stay relevant, they have to hone their communication skills and continuously expand their knowledge base—both from a business and technical perspective.

publications.title: Managing a multi-cloud environment: strategy is everything
publications.subtitle: Deloitte OnCloud Podcast
publications.description: Join David and guest Vasa Vishveshwara as they discuss the challenges and opportunities of operating in a multi-cloud environment. Vasa provides his take on how organizations can manage multi-cloud complexity and successfully navigate operations, automation, security, and provisioning to take advantage of the flexibility and power multi-cloud environments provide. He also discusses the need to develop a sound migration strategy and team-based management practices to help multi-cloud implementations fulfill their promise and provide an agile, powerful infrastructure.

detailed_profile.about: Proven strategy leader focusing on margin improvement across cost, talent, technology and risk dimensions. Specific focus within Life Sciences Pharmaceutical and Medical Technology companies with an emphasis on designing and executing global transformational programs - leveraging operating model design, process optimization, digital tools and enablers, and organization design and talent planning. Over 10 years of working globally with senior Life Sciences executives across North America, Europe, Latin America and Southeast Asia. Select functional expertise includes: Commercial Planning and Strategic Growth New Business Model Designs Finance and Shared Services Strategy, Design and Implementation Legal, Compliance and Quality Function Transformation Detailed Business Process Design Global Program Design and Execution Digital Tools and Enablers Selection and Implementation Organizational Design Change Management and Communications
