basic_info.name: Federico Evangelista - Manager at Deloitte Consulting
basic_info.search_snippet: Manager at Deloitte Consulting · I am very learning-oriented and can learn things quickly and deeply. Because of this, I am very flexible in terms of ...

detailed_profile.name: Federico Evangelista
detailed_profile.position: Manager at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: I am very learning-oriented and can learn things quickly and deeply. Because of this, I am very flexible in terms of knowledge and ability, which I think is indispensable in today's increasingly tech-centric environment. As new technologies - and in turn, new industries - emerge, I can easily adapt and leverage newly acquired knowledge and skills. Of course, the ability to learn quickly and effectively can apply in many other aspects of my work life; technology is just one facet. I am passionate about working in the tech industry, and I honestly have fun and feel at home in that environment. I am a problem solver at heart. Wrestling with problems to come up with efficient, effective answers is very stimulating for me, as is actually seeing my actions benefit other parts of my organization. There's also always a massive bonus if I have the ability to utilize my creativity to solve problems, as I love being creative as well.

experience.title: Client Services Intern
experience.description: As a Client Services Intern, I am a member of the Provisioning team. We facilitate the company's internal processes and client-facing teams by preparing their tooling and setting backend code into motion. Whenever teams need tooling or resource updates, we make sure our systems accurately reflect the change to ensure accurate reporting. I also help terminate services for clients that are no longer with the company. Lastly, I am very knowledgeable in our company's Connections product, and I am working towards standardizing processes to better deliver the product.• Streamlining and recording internal processes within the Client Services organization to make day-to-day work more timely and efficient• Communicate with clients to better understand their needs and how to properly fulfill them
experience.description_html:
As a Client Services Intern, I am a member of the Provisioning team. We facilitate the company's internal processes and client-facing teams by preparing their tooling and setting backend code into motion. Whenever teams need tooling or resource updates, we make sure our systems accurately reflect the change to ensure accurate reporting. I also help terminate services for clients that are no longer with the company. Lastly, I am very knowledgeable in our company's Connections product, and I am working towards standardizing processes to better deliver the product.

• Streamlining and recording internal processes within the Client Services organization to make day-to-day work more timely and efficient
• Communicate with clients to better understand their needs and how to properly fulfill them

recommendations: Kimberly Hardi “Humble, positive, hard working, intelligent, effective - these words only begin to describe Federico. We have had the absolute privilege of having Federico on our team for the past year. He joined our team in a provisioning role and quickly picked up this complex, dense role and made it look easy. He tackled projects and tasks that were well beyond the expected duties of an intern and outperformed our greatest expectations. Halfway through his year with us, another team requested that he join them for a short period which quickly turned into a few months because they didn't want to give him back. :) On both teams, Federico filled and excelled in roles that were full-time roles which require a degree and previous experience. We are so sad to see him go but could not be more happy for him to move on to bigger and better things. Thank you, Federico, for being such a wonderful part of our team and for working so hard for us. You are truly appreciated for all that you are. ”

volunteer_experience.info: I learned that I was very passionate about volunteering and giving back during my high school years. I became the Vice-President of our school's community service club, and I knew I wanted to continue volunteering in college.Lions Club International at the University of Texas doesn't really focus on one specific cause. There are many different types of volunteer work the organization is involved in. Personally, I have volunteered for many events that were focused on the environment. I… Show more I learned that I was very passionate about volunteering and giving back during my high school years. I became the Vice-President of our school's community service club, and I knew I wanted to continue volunteering in college.Lions Club International at the University of Texas doesn't really focus on one specific cause. There are many different types of volunteer work the organization is involved in. Personally, I have volunteered for many events that were focused on the environment. I have planted trees to prevent erosion, cut down trees to create firebreaks, and used dead trees to prevent debris from seeping into local water reservoirs.Aside from environmental issues, I have helped raise funds for international issues, such as Syrian refugees. I also care deeply about my local community, and have volunteered at warehouse sales that benefit local underprivileged youth. I've helped to paint and insulate a house that was made for an underprivileged family. Show less

basic_info.search_snippet: Managing Director at Deloitte Consulting · Chandra is the Artificial Intelligence & Data Offering Leader at Deloitte US Offices in India.

detailed_profile.name: Chandra Narra
detailed_profile.position: Managing Director at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Chandra is the Artificial Intelligence & Data Offering Leader at Deloitte US Offices in India. Chandra's expertise lies in defining, enabling, enhancing, and sustaining enterprise AI & Data solutions, solving complex business issues, and delivering industry-leading solutions. He is adept at providing advanced analytics solutions that help organizations unlock and monetize the full potential of their data through innovation and exponential technologies. Among numerous recognitions, NASSCOM (India) recognized one of his solutions through the "AI Game Changer Award For Innovative Application in AI." Chandra is a member of the Deloitte's CTO Council. He is a passionate mentor & guest speaker at multiple premier institutes & industry forums in India on Generative AI, AI/ML, Data, and Technology Trends. His experience includes: - Manage a scaled AI and data practice, be responsible for business performance, strategic growth, and build a high-performance team - Build Cloud data platforms and enable advanced analytics for multiple Global Financial Services Firms - Delivered AI solutions for connected vehicles, connected stadiums, spend analytics & consumer behavior. - Scale Gen AI and Data Science solutions from Proof of Concepts to Scaled Platforms - Incubate Innovation Ecosystems and CoEs on Data, AI/ML and Gen AI

detailed_profile.name: Minu Augustine
detailed_profile.position: Principal at Deloitte Consulting | HR Transformation & HR AI Leader
detailed_profile.about: With nearly two decades of expertise in spearheading extensive HR transformations on Oracle platform, I have been focusing on unlocking innovation through AI in HR. My proficiency lies in harnessing AI’s potential to drive tangible outcomes in HR, encompassing elevated user experience, optimized processes efficiency, and augmented productivity.

positions.subtitle: Deloitte Consulting
positions.description: With nearly two decades of expertise in spearheading extensive HR transformations on Oracle platform, I have been focusing on unlocking innovation through AI in HR. My proficiency lies in harnessing AI’s potential to drive tangible outcomes in HR, encompassing elevated user experience, optimized processes efficiency, and augmented productivity.Program Lead for HR Transformation at leading global Insurance provider across 56 countries for 40,000 employees. HR Program Manager for Oracle HCM, Finance, Supply Change implementation at the largest healthcare organization in North America on a single instance of Oracle. HR scope included self-service access for over 120,000 employees and managers across Core HR, ORC Recruiting/Onboarding, Compensation, Talent/Performance Management and Payroll. Client also transitioned from multiple systems of records across HR functions and business divisions, completed job re-architecture and compensation optimization during the project.Program Lead for Oracle HR Transformation at a leading global financial services firm operating in over 100 markets with close to 300,000 employees in more than 62 countries. Successfully led global HR Transformation program consolidating Talent, Performance management and Learn solutions to an integrated Oracle HCM Cloud platform. The Program also implemented Oracle HCM Cloud Time & Absence solution in Canada and North America Payroll and Time/Labor/Absence Management for 180,000 US employees. Strategized, planned and successfully led the three releases for Global Talent/Performance/Learn, Canada Time/Absence and US Payroll & Time/Absence with a team of over 150 practitioners. Responsible for all aspects of PMO including detailed plan and execution of the releases, risks/issues management, stakeholder engagement and go-live/sustainment readiness. Managed relationship with Oracle.
positions.title: Senior Manager
positions.description_html:
With nearly two decades of expertise in spearheading extensive HR transformations on Oracle platform, I have been focusing on unlocking innovation through AI in HR. My proficiency lies in harnessing AI’s potential to drive tangible outcomes in HR, encompassing elevated user experience, optimized processes efficiency, and augmented productivity.

Program Lead for HR Transformation at leading global Insurance provider across 56 countries for 40,000 employees.

HR Program Manager for Oracle HCM, Finance, Supply Change implementation at the largest healthcare organization in North America on a single instance of Oracle. HR scope included self-service access for over 120,000 employees and managers across Core HR, ORC Recruiting/Onboarding, Compensation, Talent/Performance Management and Payroll. Client also transitioned from multiple systems of records across HR functions and business divisions, completed job re-architecture and compensation optimization during the project.

Program Lead for Oracle HR Transformation at a leading global financial services firm operating in over 100 markets with close to 300,000 employees in more than 62 countries. Successfully led global HR Transformation program consolidating Talent, Performance management and Learn solutions to an integrated Oracle HCM Cloud platform. The Program also implemented Oracle HCM Cloud Time & Absence solution in Canada and North America Payroll and Time/Labor/Absence Management for 180,000 US employees. Strategized, planned and successfully led the three releases for Global Talent/Performance/Learn, Canada Time/Absence and US Payroll & Time/Absence with a team of over 150 practitioners. Responsible for all aspects of PMO including detailed plan and execution of the releases, risks/issues management, stakeholder engagement and go-live/sustainment readiness. Managed relationship with Oracle.

positions.subtitle: Deloitte Consulting
positions.description: As Oracle HC Operate Leader, Minu was focused on establishing Oracle HCM Cloud AMS Practice, driving sales and managing a team of over 100 practitioners supporting over 15 clients. In her role, Minu managed post live support for over 15 clients across industries including some of the largest employers live on Oracle HCM Cloud. Minu also led multiple Oracle HCM Cloud extension projects including mergers, multi-country expansions of Oracle HCM Cloud and application and business cycle upgrades including Release Upgrades, Benefits Enrollment cycles, Performance and Compensation cycles as well as Payroll Upgrade cycles.

positions.subtitle: Deloitte Consulting
positions.description: Functional Lead, Oracle HCM Cloud ImplementationLargest intermodal marketing company in the United States providing intermodal, truck brokerage and logistics services. The project focused on standardizing and automating highly manual HCM business processes through the implementation of Oracle HCM Cloud technologies. The redesigned processes have allowed the client to realize a 25% increase in driver hires which equates to a $275k increase in annual margin.Process SME – Integration Change ManagementHealthcare Service provider with over 20,000 employees with 4 inpatient locations, 9 outpatient locations and 114 sub locations and centers in the greater New York area. Having acquired a Healthcare service provider with over 5000 employees, project objective was to support all change management activities related to the migration of employees in over 13 companies of the acquired organization into the Parent company’s HR processes and PeopleSoft HCM platform.
positions.title: Manager
positions.description_html:
Functional Lead, Oracle HCM Cloud Implementation
Largest intermodal marketing company in the United States providing intermodal, truck brokerage and logistics services. The project focused on standardizing and automating highly manual HCM business processes through the implementation of Oracle HCM Cloud technologies. The redesigned processes have allowed the client to realize a 25% increase in driver hires which equates to a $275k increase in annual margin.

Process SME – Integration Change Management
Healthcare Service provider with over 20,000 employees with 4 inpatient locations, 9 outpatient locations and 114 sub locations and centers in the greater New York area. Having acquired a Healthcare service provider with over 5000 employees, project objective was to support all change management activities related to the migration of employees in over 13 companies of the acquired organization into the Parent company’s HR processes and PeopleSoft HCM platform.

positions.subtitle: Deloitte Consulting
positions.description: Project Lead and Talent Acquisition Software Specialist; 3 months. Financial Service provider with over 30,000 employees based out of 13,000 branches in US and Canada. Project assisted the client in selecting Talent Acquisition technology vendor to support talent acquisition business processes such as Recruiting, Scheduling, Hiring, Onboarding, Event Management and Contact Management. As part of the project, business requirements were validated; leading vendors identified and a sturdy mechanism established to identify the vendors best suited to meet client requirements. An accelerated RFI process was followed and shortlisted vendors for Talent Acquisition, Event Management and Contact Management were invited for product demonstrations, rated. Based on stakeholder feedback, the project concluded with business recommendations for vendors to proceed with the negotiation Functional Lead, Talent Modules – PeopleSoft HCM Reimplementation; 18 months. One of the nation's largest apparel and home furnishing retailers, the client has 115,000 employees. Since its founding in early 1900, the company has grown to be a major retailer, operating 1,100 department stores throughout the United States and Puerto Rico. The project merged two distinct HR and Payroll databases into a single HCM9.2 platform and transitioned from traditional on premise technology infrastructure to a hosted model using Oracle's Managed Cloud Services (OMCS). The project streamlined the applicant and offer extension process, particularly during the “peak hiring” season. The project was successful in removing 4,500 customizations and reducing the count of custom objects by 71% by leveraging delivered PeopleSoft HCM 9.2 functionality to the greatest extent possible, including the use of new features such as Profile Management

One of the nation's largest apparel and home furnishing retailers, the client has 115,000 employees. Since its founding in early 1900, the company has grown to be a major retailer, operating 1,100 department stores throughout the United States and Puerto Rico.
The project merged two distinct HR and Payroll databases into a single HCM9.2 platform and transitioned from traditional on premise technology infrastructure to a hosted model using Oracle's Managed Cloud Services (OMCS). The project streamlined the applicant and offer extension process, particularly during the “peak hiring” season. The project was successful in removing 4,500 customizations and reducing the count of custom objects by 71% by leveraging delivered PeopleSoft HCM 9.2 functionality to the greatest extent possible, including the use of new features such as Profile Management

basic_info.search_snippet: Principal at Deloitte Consulting · Nate Paynter is a leader in the Human Capital Organization & Talent practice. Nate works with Fortune 1000 companies to ...

detailed_profile.name: Nathaniel Paynter
detailed_profile.position: Principal at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Nate Paynter is a leader in the Human Capital Organization & Talent practice. Nate works with Fortune 1000 companies to re-envision and transform how they operate, organize and evolve the way they work as they compete in a consumer centric, digitally driven market ecosystem. He has 20+ years of experience delivering sustainable transformation value with a focus on intentional leadership planning, organization design, workforce transition, change leadership and talent practice design. Nate’s work spans enterprise and functional transformation and he brings direct experience working with Technology, Digital, Merchandising, Operations, Marketing, Supply Chain and HR functions. Nate has a passion for delivering tactical solutions that achieve strategic business value and create sustainable change. He is a thought leader at Deloitte and focuses his thinking on harnessing Human Capital to deliver an organization’s digital ambition.

detailed_profile.about: Daniel Ryu is an analyst in the Enterprise Performance offering portfolio at Deloitte Consulting. He graduated from Indiana University with a major in Finance and served in the Korean Army as an artillery section chief sergeant. His engagement experience includes strategy/roadmap design, business process analyses, and system design/implementation in the large-scale finance technology strategy and transformation projects for US-based commercial clients. His previous internships involved investigating the post-close integration strategy for a global legal software company and conducting preliminary financial and operational diligence (FDD, ODD) for middle-market SaaS companies. As a former member of the Korean Junior National Baseball Team, Daniel possesses strong qualitative skills such as team building, time management, and proactive communication. He has also accumulated technical skills through previous work and Deloitte engagements such as Visio, Tableau, and Workday Financials. He is passionate about corporate strategy, commercial diligence, and finance transformation in the TMT and consumer industries.

detailed_profile.name: Faheem J.
detailed_profile.position: Manager at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: At my core, I am an information seeker and disseminator fueled by helping others overcome the challenges they are facing – personally and professionally. I welcome taking on the opportunity to solve difficult problems with other inspiring and driven individuals and I thrive in collaborative, team-based cultures. These passions of mine have led me to pursue a career at Deloitte Consulting LLP where I am currently a Manager. I primarily focus on digital and large scale organizational transformation work in the Technology, Media, Telecommunications and Sports sector with a focus on product management and project management. I hold an MBA from Northwestern University - Kellogg School of Management where I concentrated in Strategy, Marketing, and Leadership Development as well as a B.S.B. from the University of Minnesota - Twin Cities with majors in Management Information Systems and Finance. My inbox is always open to meet new people, discuss, and learn together about strategy, technology, marketing, building relationships, sports, and opportunities to grow! If you would like to chat with me, feel free to schedule some time on my calendar here: https://cal.com/faheemjabir

projects.title: Real-time Motorsports Data Collection
projects.description: I am the electronics lead for the Pack Motorsports Baja club at NCSU (since September 2018). Our club competes in the SAE Baja Collegiate Series every year. Last year was the first that our club integrated any electronics or active data collection hardware on a vehicle. This year we are turning that to 11. We are integrating many more sensors (redesigned fuel gauge, brake pressure, engine RPM, gearbox RPM, and more). The sensor data is recorded on-vehicle while also connecting to a driver display mobile app through Bluetooth Low Energy to display values in real-time. These values are also sent to a database over a cellular connection so that they may be seen in real-time by offtrack observers. If you'd like to learn more about the team you can find our website here: https://www.ncstatebaja.com/.

projects.title: Orbitron (Strategy Game)
projects.description: This was an honors project I made for my intro programming course at NCSU in the 2016 Spring semester. Since the course didn't even begin to talk about object-oriented programming until the last few weeks of the semester, I spent a lot of my own time learning and understanding OOP concepts and applying them in my game. Overall, I had a ton of fun working on the project and learning from it.

organizations.title: Pack Motorsports Baja at NCSU
organizations.description: The Baja motorsports club at NC State is a student-run organization that designs, builds, and races an off-road Baja vehicle every year. We attend national competitions held by the Society of Automotive Engineers. I have been serving as the electronics lead since August of 2018 when I joined the club.You can see more about the club here: https://www.ncstatebaja.com/.

detailed_profile.position: Manager at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: A proud Philly girl who now resides in Washington, DC. I have a Bachelor of Arts degree in Communication with a specific focus in public relations from The University of Maryland. I am currently working for Deloitte Consulting. I am a driven individual who dreams of traveling and exploring but is secretly a homebody. I grew up in Philadelphia, but I look forward to living in new cities and new states throughout my career. I am never afraid to take on leadership positions and I truly enjoy working with others and sharing ideas. I enjoy writing, whether pr related or creative, and have always loved working closely with others to solve a challenging problem. I look forward to my future in communications and hope to connect with as many people as possible. Please feel free to contact me to talk!

detailed_profile.name: Robert Simmons
detailed_profile.city: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
detailed_profile.position: Specialist Leader at Deloitte Consulting LLP
detailed_profile.about: Ever since I can remember I have loved to build things. I purchased my first car, a 1970 GTO, at 14 and rebuilt the engine and added a “his & her” transmission. This was probably the impetus behind starting my career as an engineer. I have worn many hats throughout my career – programmer, operation researcher, product designer, data analysis engineer and business consultant. This has enabled me to develop multi-faceted solutions using diverse concepts while managing multi-disciplinary projects. Everybody sees the world through their own experiences; I see the world as an opportunity to build better organizations aligning people, process and technology with strategy. - I love leading development of solutions to business needs. - I care who gets the credit, the team gets the credit. - If I can’t measure it, I can’t align, manage or improve it; I can measure anything. - I develop new methodologies to solve business problems, and I execute them. I enjoy fostering relationships with clients, co-workers, industry experts or just to hear new experiences. If you are interested and would like a sounding board or discuss new ideas, just reach out! Specialties: Functional - Business Process Reengineering, Organizational Effectiveness, Change Management, Performance Management, Data Analytics, IT requirements and Business Development. Markets – Public Sector culture and strategies, Human Resource Processes covering Compensation, Benefits and Staff Engagement.

basic_info.name: Andrew Blau
basic_info.search_snippet: Andrew leads Eminence and Insights for Deloitte Consulting, where he helps sharpen Deloitte's perspectives on the most important issues shaping organizations ...

detailed_profile.name: Andrew Blau
detailed_profile.position: US Leader, Eminence & Insights at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Andrew leads Eminence and Insights for Deloitte Consulting, where he helps sharpen Deloitte’s perspectives on the most important issues shaping organizations and markets, including the firm's "Signature Issues." Previously, he launched and led Deloitte’s Strategic Risk Solutions practice, created to help senior executives and boards spot and prepare for disruption and other fundamental threats to their competitive position and business model. He also served as senior adviser to the Chief Strategy Officer, guiding internal efforts to develop and refine strategy for Deloitte and many of its practice areas, and as a Deloitte “Blockchain Fellow,” advising clients and Deloitte on the implications of the technology. Andrew’s work ranges widely across topics crucial to business, government, and NGO leaders: from the future of personal mobility and transportation to the future of health and healthcare, and from the future of global commerce to the evolution of corporate strategy. He has advised CEOs and leadership teams across many fields, including telecommunications, media, financial services, automotive,consumer products, health care/life science, industrials, energy, and philanthropy, and served clients on six of the world’s seven continents. He is the co-author of “Looking Out for the Future” which explored how social problem-solving could become more effective over the next generation, and author of “Deep Focus” a study of the emerging media landscape and the opportunities and risks for media and technology companies. He was the founding president of the board of directors of WITNESS, an international human rights organization founded by the musician Peter Gabriel, and has served in many other voluntary roles, including as Chairman of the Urban Libraries Council.

publications.description: Corporate Boards can collaborate with management to make use of time-tested tools to help organizations improve resilience in a rapidly changing landscape. detailed_profile.name: Erin Doshier (Mulkey)
detailed_profile.position: M.Ed. | Campus Recruiter at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Driven by a passion for supporting students and enabling personal and professional development in others, I currently serve as a Campus Recruiter at Deloitte Consulting. After starting my career at Deloitte working as a Consultant for four years, I transitioned into the world of higher education and career coaching while pursuing my Masters of Higher Education at the University of Texas at Austin. Now back at Deloitte, I have worn many hats in my recruiting role over the last several years and I look forward to continuing to work with both students and colleagues from all over the country, each with their own Why Deloitte story. Outside of my professional role, I love long distance running, taking endless pictures of my dog, and working part-time as a Pilates instructor in Austin.

In this role, I also serve on the BNSF Neeley Leadership Program Cabinet and assist in program initiatives and decision making.

organizations.title: Frog Aides, Student Government Association
organizations.description: After being selected as a Frog Aide in the Student Government Association's first-year leadership program, I was a member of the Executive Leadership Team for the 2014-2015 school year. I then served as a Frog Aides Co-Director for the 2015-2016 school year. In this position, I worked to create curriculum and activities focused on leadership development for the incoming Frog Aides class. I also managed and oversaw five small group committees facilitated by Frog Aides Executive Team members working on a semester long project aimed at increasing national and global political awareness to college students.

basic_info.name: Andrew Blau
basic_info.search_snippet: Andrew leads Eminence and Insights for Deloitte Consulting, where he helps sharpen Deloitte's perspectives on the most important issues shaping organizations ...

detailed_profile.name: Andrew Blau
detailed_profile.position: US Leader, Eminence & Insights at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Andrew leads Eminence and Insights for Deloitte Consulting, where he helps sharpen Deloitte’s perspectives on the most important issues shaping organizations and markets, including the firm's "Signature Issues." Previously, he launched and led Deloitte’s Strategic Risk Solutions practice, created to help senior executives and boards spot and prepare for disruption and other fundamental threats to their competitive position and business model. He also served as senior adviser to the Chief Strategy Officer, guiding internal efforts to develop and refine strategy for Deloitte and many of its practice areas, and as a Deloitte “Blockchain Fellow,” advising clients and Deloitte on the implications of the technology. Andrew’s work ranges widely across topics crucial to business, government, and NGO leaders: from the future of personal mobility and transportation to the future of health and healthcare, and from the future of global commerce to the evolution of corporate strategy. He has advised CEOs and leadership teams across many fields, including telecommunications, media, financial services, automotive,consumer products, health care/life science, industrials, energy, and philanthropy, and served clients on six of the world’s seven continents. He is the co-author of “Looking Out for the Future” which explored how social problem-solving could become more effective over the next generation, and author of “Deep Focus” a study of the emerging media landscape and the opportunities and risks for media and technology companies. He was the founding president of the board of directors of WITNESS, an international human rights organization founded by the musician Peter Gabriel, and has served in many other voluntary roles, including as Chairman of the Urban Libraries Council.

publications.title: Leadership in turbulent times: Better foresight, better choices
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Center for Board Effectiveness / On the Board's Agenda
publications.description: Corporate Boards can collaborate with management to make use of time-tested tools to help organizations improve resilience in a rapidly changing landscape. Scenario planning—a technique specifically created to navigate uncertain futures—is one such tool that boards and leaders can rely on to help their organizations do more than simply react to and recover from the recent turbulence.

publications.title: The World Remade by COVID-19
publications.description: The World Remade by COVID-19 offers a view of how businesses and society may develop over the next three to five years as the world navigates the potential long-term implications of the global pandemic.Our view is based on scenarios—stories about the future designed to spark insight and spot opportunity—created by some of the world’s best-known scenario thinkers. The collaborative dialogue hosted by Deloitte and Salesforce continues the companies’ tradition of providing foresight and insight that inform resilient leaders,

publications.title: Truths and Consequences: Four Drivers of Change That Threaten Business As Usual
publications.subtitle: Inside Magazine (CEO/CFO Edition)
publications.description: There are four new truths of the marketplace that are shaping the future of business. Visible all around us yet rarely considered as a group, they are powering waves of innovation in every sector. They are the new constants in a changing world, lowering barriers to entry, unlocking opportunities, and increasing the likelihood of new competition—and business model disruption—for incumbents.

detailed_profile.name: Erin Doshier (Mulkey)
detailed_profile.position: M.Ed. | Campus Recruiter at Deloitte Consulting
detailed_profile.about: Driven by a passion for supporting students and enabling personal and professional development in others, I currently serve as a Campus Recruiter at Deloitte Consulting. After starting my career at Deloitte working as a Consultant for four years, I transitioned into the world of higher education and career coaching while pursuing my Masters of Higher Education at the University of Texas at Austin. Now back at Deloitte, I have worn many hats in my recruiting role over the last several years and I look forward to continuing to work with both students and colleagues from all over the country, each with their own Why Deloitte story. Outside of my professional role, I love long distance running, taking endless pictures of my dog, and working part-time as a Pilates instructor in Austin.

publications.title: The New Government Leader: Mobilizing Agile Public Leadership in Disruptive Times
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: What makes an effective government leader in a world where citizens expect real-time engagement with their institutions and whose social problems often defy siloed solutions? This study suggests six new behaviors that tomorrow’s government leader will need in order to meet increased expectations for citizen interaction and to cope with an increasingly complex operating environment. It also profiles several forward-thinking individuals who are finding new ways engage, shape and create in public service.

publications.title: Data as the new currency: Government’s role in facilitating the exchange
publications.subtitle: Deloitte University Press
publications.description: Government is one of the biggest producers of data—and one of the few that deliver data to the public free of charge. Governments already regulate how organizations may use personal data and myriad other issues related to data. The question, then, isn’t really whether government should get involved in the new data marketplace, but rather how it should take part.

detailed_profile.name: Christine Ahn
detailed_profile.position: Principal Deloitte Consulting Services
detailed_profile.about: Chris Ahn is a 20+ year partner with responsibilities as the Global Chief Commercial Officer and Lead Client Service Partner for NVIDIA. The alliance's mission is to advance clients' AI agendas that will revolutionize the enterprise. Chris served clients mostly in the consumer industry; consumer products, retail and transportation. She worked with the Office of the CFO; changing operating models including process and policy, technology systems, organization and talent. Chris has lived and worked in Asia (China, Korea, Taiwan), and Europe (Germany, Spain, U.K). In 2015, Chris seconded to China for 3+ years to build the Consulting practice, serving as the Strategy & Operations lead. In addition to her NVIDIA roles, Chris serves on the Consulting Services Board of Directors.

publications.subtitle: Deloitte

publications.title: Webinar: Why it’s time for a new approach to wire processing
publications.subtitle: Volante Technologies

publications.title: Payments Industry Analytics
publications.subtitle: UNC Analytics Conference
publications.description: The payments industry is undergoing significant disruption. Billions of transactions are flowing through the payments ecosystem creating huge volumes of data - this is one industry that really knows where the individuals and businesses are spending!! The industry is eager to leverage this data not only for driving its own growth and efficiency but also provide insight and value to other industries. Innovations in data sciences and technology have been a key enabler of this phenomenon. In this session we will explore the key applications of data sciences to the Payments industry and the advances in data sciences that have enabled this application.

publications.title: B2B Payments - A Significant Untapped Opportunity
publications.subtitle: Deloitte
publications.description: Business-to-business (B2B) payments represent a large and fast-growing market that has not yet received the same degree of focus from financial institutions (FIs) as that of business-to-consumer (B2C) payments. The US B2B payments market is estimated at ~$16Tr (2014) and growing at 5.8% CAGR (2014-2020) representing a significant opportunity for those who play in this space.

publications.title: B2B payments for the middle market: Addressing unmet needs to tap into a new pathway for growth
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Consulting
publications.description: The large and thriving US middle market historically has been largely underserved in its business-to-business (B2B) payments needs. As a result, many sellers and buyers are experiencing significant frustration with the B2B payments process. And while financial institutions1 (FIs) are increasingly targeting middle market growth opportunities, they could do more to address the segment’s payments pain points.If FIs plan to tap into this new pathway for growth, their B2B payments offerings should help middle market companies manage broader business and growth challenges along with addressing specific payments pain points. This dual focus will become increasingly important as the US modernizes its payments infrastructure, core processing capabilities become commoditized, and disruptive newcomers move quickly to try to grab the lion’s share of this promising market.

publications.title: Journey Into Faster Payments a presentation at BAI Payments Connect
publications.subtitle: Deloitte
publications.description: Addressing key questions on the minds of stakeholders as the US takes steps to modernize its Payments ecosystem:•What does Faster Payments mean for you? Very soon every market player in the payments space will be touched by Faster Payments in some way or the other•Is Faster Payments real? Faster payments is no more a hype, it’s a change for the better. Faster payment is swell that is quickly going to turn into a wave.•How fast is fast? Faster payments speed means different things to different people – depending on the use case•What is the US Faster Payments Architecture? A number of initiatives underway, but it is most likely a hybrid solution with multiple market players involved•Is faster secure? Institutions will need enhanced real time capabilities to make real time payments secure enough. Consumers will need to understand liability shifts•What should you do to prepare? Assess your business, operations and technology landscape to determine areas that might be impacted by Faster Payments and develop plans to prepare. Consider lead times in product development and implementation

publications.title: Driving Change: Five questions every bank must answer to justify a core transformation
publications.subtitle: Deloitte Consulting
publications.description: While banks around the world have tackled core transformation and are already reaping the rewards, U.S. banks, which have largely remained on the sidelines, are taking notice. Is it time for U.S. banks to finally take on the challenge of core transformation? In this article, we’ve identified five questions – which our clients are being frequently asked about their business from a range of stakeholders, including investors, regulators, the board, and senior management – that can help sharpen your thinking about the impact of a core transformation. These questions aren’t just for technology leaders. They span the C-Suite. Anyone who has a stake in increasing the effectiveness of the business should have an interest in answering these questions.

positions.subtitle: City Year Chicago
positions.description: Recruiter: Identify qualified and invested change agents to join City Year's annual cohort of AmeriCorps members. Build relationships with key City Year champions such as university career centers, advisors, professors, students, and student organizations. Generate organic recruitment opportunities, leverage social media, and craft champaign messaging during peak hiring periods. Construct hiring reports utilizing year-over-year data and performance metrics to understand and deepen recruitment strategy across state universities and liberal arts institutions. Develop, coordinate, and facilitate experiential professional development workshops at portfolio colleges and community organizations.Marketing and Communications Recruitment Working Group Member: Provide live updates and feedback to City Year Headquarters Marketing and Communications team to enhance recruitment process and candidate experience. Gather input from team members to elevate to marketing and communication team. Filter updates from the marketing and communications team to local, Chicago-based Recruitment and Admissions team. Lead Chicago site-based Recruitment and Admissions team meetings, gathering input from teammates and coordinating with colleagues as needed to ensure smooth collaboration between teams. CYPRIDE Employee Resource Group Co-Leader: Facilitate leadership committee planning meetings and general, all-member ERG meetings. Elevate opportunities for member leadership. Attend networking events to better understand ERG approaches across other organizations. Be present as a general resource to LGBTQ+ identifying AmeriCorps members at City Year.

recommendations: Alex Lapshin “Patrick is one of the most well-spoken, detail-oriented and hardworking practitioners I have met at the firm and one that I look up to in my endeavors as a junior practitioner. He possesses excellent leadership skills that I have personally experienced. He would lead by example by guiding me through the client deliverables and firm initiatives that we would work on together. Although he spends the time to help teach and mentor others, he would still find time to get the job done for the client. Patrick challenges junior practitioners that he works with to grow by asking them to think about solutions to problems with depth and rigor. This left a lasting impact on me since I was well-prepared compared to my peers to take on a client role beyond my level. I look forward to any future opportunities to partner with Patrick.”

experience.title: Account Development & Inside Sales Co-op
experience.description: My responsibility was to manage a list of named accounts to grow the pipeline of sales opportunities for the Enterprise Sales Team at GE Intelligent Platforms. My primary areas of focus are operational management software (MES) and real time operational intelligence software for the Food and Beverage and Complex Manufacturing verticals.Highlights:• Created VITO letters to clearly illustrate the value of GEIP to potential new customers. • Worked directly with Enterprise Account Executives to strategically target new accounts• Secured meetings with C-level and VP-level stakeholders and decision makers at new accounts where our solutions could add value• Performed Inside Sales role to quote software packages for distributers and reps• Constructed a comprehensive training guide for new hires highlighting the Account Development process and best practices• Trained new hires on the account development team
experience.description_html:
My responsibility was to manage a list of named accounts to grow the pipeline of sales opportunities for the Enterprise Sales Team at GE Intelligent Platforms. My primary areas of focus are operational management software (MES) and real time operational intelligence software for the Food and Beverage and Complex Manufacturing verticals.

Highlights:
• Created VITO letters to clearly illustrate the value of GEIP to potential new customers.
• Worked directly with Enterprise Account Executives to strategically target new accounts
• Secured meetings with C-level and VP-level stakeholders and decision makers at new accounts where our solutions could add value
• Performed Inside Sales role to quote software packages for distributers and reps
• Constructed a comprehensive training guide for new hires highlighting the Account Development process and best practices
• Trained new hires on the account development team

experience.title: Region Market Development Co-op
experience.description: My responsibility was to assist marketing the GE Energy portfolio to customers in the Northeast and Midwest US. My primary areas of focus were segmentation, market analysis, strategic planning, and lead generation. Highlights:• Optimized a lead discover process and exposed >$20MM of previously unidentified service leads• Created an in-depth Energy market analysis by state including capacity, generation, and           distribution details for the Northeast and Midwest US• Conducted market research to vet a new application for current GE Energy product, the project was a team effort combining resources across different GE businesses and functions• Assisted in a strategic planning effort to segment potential new customers for GE Energy's Heavy Duty Gas Turbines and identify the best-fit technology
experience.description_html:
My responsibility was to assist marketing the GE Energy portfolio to customers in the Northeast and Midwest US. My primary areas of focus were segmentation, market analysis, strategic planning, and lead generation.

Highlights:
• Optimized a lead discover process and exposed >$20MM of previously unidentified service leads
• Created an in-depth Energy market analysis by state including capacity, generation, and distribution details for the Northeast and Midwest US
• Conducted market research to vet a new application for current GE Energy product, the project was a team effort combining resources across different GE businesses and functions
• Assisted in a strategic planning effort to segment potential new customers for GE Energy's Heavy Duty Gas Turbines and identify the best-fit technology

experience.title: Advanced Manufacturing Engineer Co-op
experience.description: My responsibility was to assist in the role of a quality engineer and manufacturing engineer in the Rotor Assembly cell at GE’s gas turbine manufacturing facility in Greenville, SC. My primary areas of focus were lean manufacturing, process improvement, tool design, and quality control.Highlights:•	Initiated and coordinated a six-sigma project to assess a new grinding process to reduce defects. I was responsible for all aspects of the project including working with suppliers to buy the necessary equipment, developing  a standard operating procedure for the grinding process, and collaborating with other GE manufacturing facilities globally to learn best practices used with similar processes. •	Collaborated with and managed the relationship with suppliers to design, manufacture, and validate new production tooling•	Worked with machinists and engineering to develop, evaluate, and update manufacturing methods to ensure product quality and employee safety
experience.description_html:
My responsibility was to assist in the role of a quality engineer and manufacturing engineer in the Rotor Assembly cell at GE’s gas turbine manufacturing facility in Greenville, SC. My primary areas of focus were lean manufacturing, process improvement, tool design, and quality control.

Highlights:
• Initiated and coordinated a six-sigma project to assess a new grinding process to reduce defects. I was responsible for all aspects of the project including working with suppliers to buy the necessary equipment, developing a standard operating procedure for the grinding process, and collaborating with other GE manufacturing facilities globally to learn best practices used with similar processes.
• Collaborated with and managed the relationship with suppliers to design, manufacture, and validate new production tooling
• Worked with machinists and engineering to develop, evaluate, and update manufacturing methods to ensure product quality and employee safety

experience.title: Statistical Engineer Co-op
experience.description: My responsibility was to assist the statistical engineering group at Bose Corporation. The statistical engineering group worked with engineers in R&D and engineers in manufacturing to perform data collection and analysis. My primary areas of focus were design of experiment, statistical modeling and analysis, process validation, lean manufacturing, and data collection. Highlights:•	Created statistical reports to display results from data collection. Reports included statistical models, correlation matrices, and other visuals to show variation and trends within the collected data. •	Worked with NPI teams to validate new production equipment and run capability analysis•	Designed an experiment to statistically validate a new speaker testing program •	Assisted engineers in performing statistical analysis of data for six-sigma black belt projects
experience.description_html:
My responsibility was to assist the statistical engineering group at Bose Corporation. The statistical engineering group worked with engineers in R&D and engineers in manufacturing to perform data collection and analysis. My primary areas of focus were design of experiment, statistical modeling and analysis, process validation, lean manufacturing, and data collection.

Highlights:
• Created statistical reports to display results from data collection. Reports included statistical models, correlation matrices, and other visuals to show variation and trends within the collected data.
• Worked with NPI teams to validate new production equipment and run capability analysis
• Designed an experiment to statistically validate a new speaker testing program
• Assisted engineers in performing statistical analysis of data for six-sigma black belt projects

experience.title: Founder
experience.description: Growing up I always had an interest in cars. When I was fifteen and a half my dad and I bought a 1998 Jeep Wrangler together. This was my dream car and my baby. At the time I still wasn’t old enough to drive but I kept the car looking like new. One afternoon a family friend came over while I was finishing detailing the Jeep impressed by how clean my Jeep was he asked: “if I paid you would you detail my car?” Without hesitation I agreed. By word of mouth I soon had several customers and I named my new car detailing business Alpine Auto-detailing. I learned a lot detailing cars for five summers as the business matured and grew each year. I started my own website, launched a small marketing campaign, and learned the how to manage costs and pricing. The list of takeaways from this experience goes on but the most important lesson I learned was hard work and great customer service are the key to success.

One afternoon a family friend came over while I was finishing detailing the Jeep impressed by how clean my Jeep was he asked: “if I paid you would you detail my car?” Without hesitation I agreed. By word of mouth I soon had several customers and I named my new car detailing business Alpine Auto-detailing. I learned a lot detailing cars for five summers as the business matured and grew each year. I started my own website, launched a small marketing campaign, and learned the how to manage costs and pricing. The list of takeaways from this experience goes on but the most important lesson I learned was hard work and great customer service are the key to success.

recommendations: Michael Gayowski “Date January 24, 2012 Name Michael J. Gayowski Address 31 Eldridge Road City, State, Zip Boxborough, MA 01824 To: Alpine Auto Detailing John C Malley Bolton, MA Dear Mr. Malley. Subject: Appreciation letter for excellent automotive services offered. I would like to extend my heartfelt thanks for the excellent services offered by you to our organization. I appreciate the way you conducted business with us. Your services were really exemplary, timely and delivered with a high level to detail. You have managed this project in a timely manner, and after speaking with your clients they also have appreciated your leadership skills in managing these types of tasks in a professional way. I would like to admit that it is rare to find high standards of genuineness and reliability in the today’s business world. It would be my pleasure to hire your services in the future and I sincerely wish all the very best for a successful future. I look forward to doing business with you again. Sincerely yours, Michael J. Gayowski VP Biscom, Inc.”
